p: Multi-model ensembles hold promise for giving decision makers the ability to use “one answer” that combines the strengths of many different modeling approaches while mitigating their weaknesses. This work presents the first attempt to systematically combine infectious disease forecasts from multiple research groups in real-time using an approach that factors in the past performance of each component method. Of the 29 models submitted to the CDC in 2017/2018 as part of their annual FluSight forecasting challenge, this ensemble was the second-highest scoring model overall. The top scoring model was an ensemble of human judgment forecasts [ 31].
